qas.question: What's the most popular church in Samoa?

Where is the Bahá'í place of worship located in Samoa?
What Samoan Head of State might have worshiped at the Bahá'í House of Worship?
What church's religion does 19.4% of the Samoan population practice?

context: Samoans' religious adherence includes the following: <a0_0>Christian Congregational Church of Samoa<a0_0/> 31.8%, <a4_0>Roman Catholic<a4_0/> 19.4%, Methodist <b5_0>15.2%<b5_0/>, Assembly of God 13.7%, Mormon <a1_0>7.6%<a1_0/>, Seventh-day Adventist 3.9%, Worship Centre 1.7%, other Christian 5.5%, other 0.7%, none 0.1%, unspecified 0.1% (2011 estimate). The Head of State until 2007, <a3_0><b6_0>His Highness Malietoa Tanumafili II<b6_0/><a3_0/>, was a Bahá'í convert. Samoa hosts one of seven Bahá'í Houses of Worship in the world; completed in <b7_0>1984<b7_0/> and dedicated by <b8_0>the Head of State<b8_0/>, it is located in <a2_0><b9_0>Tiapapata<b9_0/><a2_0/>, 8 km (5 mi) from Apia.
